  • Uses of ResourceNotFoundException in com.library.controller

    Methods in com.library.controller that throw ResourceNotFoundException
    Modifier and Type Method Description
    org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Book> UserBookController.addUserBook​(long bookId)
    Adds the user to the book which means the book status is now pending.
    org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.List<Book>> LibrarianBookController.getAllBooksByAuthor​(java.lang.String name)
    Search all books by author, even those that are not available for Users, which means they are taken by some user.
    org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.List<Book>> LibrarianBookController.getAllBooksByName​(java.lang.String name)
    Search all books by name, even those that are not available for Users, which means they are taken by some user.
    org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.List<AvailableBooks>> UserBookController.getAvailableBooksByAuthor​(java.lang.String name)
    Search all books by author, only those that are available, that has book status flag as R(Received) or null.
    org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.util.List<AvailableBooks>> UserBookController.getAvailableBooksByName​(java.lang.String name)
    Search all books by name, only those that are available, that has book status flag as R(Received) or null.
    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Boolean> LibrarianBookController.returnBook​(long bookId)
    If the user is kind enough to return book to the library, without torn pages or whatsoever, just give the book id, system will do the rest.
    org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Book> LibrarianBookController.updateBook​(long bookId, BookDTO bookDetails)
    Update Book, by providing name, isbn and author.
    org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<ParameterMst> LibrarianBookController.updateParam​(long paramId, ParameterMst paramDetails)
    Updates Parameter data (if Librarian wants to increase or decrease the return date.)
